alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Dickens; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 7:19PM CST until February 26 at 8:15PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kent County in northwestern Texas... Eastern Dickens County in northwestern Texas... King County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Motley County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Cottle County in northwestern Texas... Stonewall County in northwestern Texas... * Until 815 PM CST. * At 718 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Paducah to 13 miles northeast of Jayton to 10 miles east of Fluvanna, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Aspermont, Jayton, Guthrie, Girard, Grow, Peacock, Dumont, Finney, Old Glory, Swenson, and Clairemont. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for northwestern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Cottle; Dickens; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall
